image.altText: The shape of the grass fire scar from the Natimuk blaze

props.synopsis: The anatomy of the Natimuk fire offers a glimpse into a new and faster kind of bushfire — and the growing vulnerability of communities as climate change fuels dangerous conditions.

title.children: No time to warn or to prepare: Natimuk met the fire of our future

image.altText: Woman with brown hair and man with white hair, a beard and hat stand in front of burnt house ruin.

props.synopsis: Several Victorian fires have been left out of mainstream media coverage, and one missed out on the Victorian government's initial support list, which has led to disappointment.

title.children: Burnt communities 'feel forgotten' in fire coverage and support

image.altText: Cars swept away by flood waters seen from a police aircraft on Thursday.

props.synopsis: Emergency services have defended warning times as locals recover from the record-breaking rains and worst floods in the area since the 80s.

title.children: Clean-up continues along Great Ocean Road after disastrous floods

image.altText: An older woman in an orange jumper and red beanie, with long brown hair and glasses, holding a book and speaking.

props.synopsis: After more than a century of silence, the Bunurong language is being brought back to life by elders, linguists and community.

title.children: New dictionary aims to 'awaken' language not spoken fluently for 100 years

image.altText: dark clouds hover kurnell in sydney

props.synopsis: January is the middle of Australia's severe weather season and a multitude of hazards are emerging across the country this weekend.

title.children: Rain and cyclone threat in weekend of weather hazards across Australia

image.altText: A person leans on an oval fence while kids stand nearby with bikes in front of a large round hole in the green grass.

props.synopsis: The state's road building authority says a planned test should have been aborted given the circumstances, as tunnelling recommences for the North-East Link tunnel project.

title.children: Melbourne sinkhole caused by test that 'should not have taken place'

image.altText: Acting Inspector Dale Maxwell

props.synopsis: Victoria Police has arrested three teenagers aged between 13 and 16 after they allegedly broke into a home, wielding machetes.

title.children: Teens arrested following violent home invasion in Melbourne's south-east

image.altText: A close up of a woman's hand holding a cross necklace.

props.synopsis: Documents leaked to the ABC reveal an "apocalyptic Christian cult" is targeting Ballarat, Bendigo, Geelong and Darwin.

title.children: Ex-member says Shincheonji 'cult' spreading across the country

image.altText: A pile of tyres in a paddock is seen on fire.

props.synopsis: Dozens of firefighters worked to contain the fast-moving blaze, which burned through a paddock and a pile of tyres as it approached homes near Melton.

title.children: Smoke warning after grassfire races towards homes in outer Melbourne

image.altText: Aerial shots of flood damage near the Great Ocean Road

props.synopsis: The Lorne caravan park will be closed for weeks after record-breaking rains turned into "terrifying" floodwaters, sweeping cars into the ocean and inundating holiday parks along Victoria's Great Ocean Road.

title.children: Great Ocean Road clean-up begins after deluge causes 'terrifying' flash flooding

image.altText: Thumbnail pic matt Fowles

props.synopsis: Two wineries in the Strathbogie Ranges have lost a combined 150 hectares of vines, 3,000 sheep and three homes in the Victorian fires.

title.children: Winemakers face long road to recovery after fire destroys vineyards

image.altText: Two cars washed to sea near the town of Wye River.

props.synopsis: People in a popular holiday region have been issued with an emergency warning after a storm cell dumped more than 100 millimetres of rain, flooding campsites.

title.children: Cars washed to sea, rain record smashed in Great Ocean Road deluge

image.altText: Dozens of people on water ski boats at a river bank, with the Murray River in the background

props.synopsis: A report into the safety of ski racing on rivers is proposing to ban river racing events and limit speeds following multiple fatalities in recent years.

title.children: Safety investigation proposes banning waterski racing on rivers

image.altText: An old newspaper clipping photo of two men and two women raising drinks.

props.synopsis: With whisky and lollies for sustenance and pigeons their only means of communication, Steve Harris and Doug Fleming crossed Bass Strait in a 4.5m dinghy in 1974.

title.children: Two blokes, whisky and lollies on a 'foolhardy' Bass Strait crossing

image.altText: Finn Allen holds up his helmet and bat

props.synopsis: Finn Allen saves his best ever BBL innings for when it matters most as the Perth Scorchers out-duel the Melbourne Renegades.

title.children: Kiwi star's maiden BBL ton sends Scorchers into finals

image.altText: A man and woman with dark hair look tired as their toddler daughter sits on her mother's lap

props.synopsis: Four weeks after unpacking their last box, a Harcourt family fled fire with only their passports and clothes — and now face a difficult search for a new rental.

title.children: Fire leaves Harcourt family searching for home in tight rental market

image.altText: Storm Hunter yells in celebration while holding racquet

props.synopsis: Storm Hunter books her spot in the main draw of the Australian Open — something that was inconceivable last year as she battled injuries that left her in tears mid-match.

title.children: Teary Hunter says Aus Open berth 'meant the world' after injury heartache

image.altText: Thanasi Kokkinakis shrugs his shoulders

props.synopsis: Thanasi Kokkinakis has pulled out of the Australian Open singles before the draw could be announced after suffering a shoulder injury playing in Adelaide.

title.children: Kokkinakis injury setback rules him out of Australian Open

image.altText: London Bridge before collapse with two distant figures silhouetted on bridge. Edited with pull out zoomed in section of figures.

props.synopsis: Kelli Bryers wasn't sure if anyone had seen the London Bridge collapse just seconds after she and her cousin, David Darrington, had crossed it.

title.children: 'No joke, London Bridge has fallen down': The moment two tourists were trapped by nature

image.altText: Tom Silvagni, whose name was suppressed throughout his criminal proceedings, pictured in a suit outside court.

props.synopsis: Details of the 23-year-old's appeal bid have been released, with Silvagni arguing a judge erred in describing certain evidence as "incriminating conduct" during his rape trial late last year.

title.children: Tom Silvagni's rape conviction appeal grounds revealed

image.altText: woman's hand hold a little boys hand, deidentified

props.synopsis: Families who turned to social media to find an au pair say the lack of safeguards left them vulnerable to serious problems.

title.children: Families warn of risks after hiring au pairs through social media

image.altText: GettyImages-2239660329

props.synopsis: The Australian Open has smashed attendance records in what is being marketed as "Opening Week", featuring fan events and qualifying matches, but the main draw does not start until Sunday.

title.children: Complaints roll in as record crowds watch qualifiers in AO 'Opening Week'

image.altText: Houses in the suburb of Glebe in Hobart

props.synopsis: Australia's rental market is "starting to rebalance" with prices flat in some capital cities but affordability remains a concern, according to Domain, which says an annual salary of $100,000 is needed to live comfortably.

title.children: Rental market growth stalls as tenants hit limit of what they can pay

image.altText: Woman wearing a suit holding her hands out

props.synopsis: Liberals are backing away from a push to tackle antisemitism with stronger racial hatred laws, with some senior figures in the party also voicing freedom of speech concerns.

title.children: Ley signals Liberals won't back 'unsalvageable' hate crime, gun control reforms

image.altText: A boy faces a teacher who is standing in front of a blackboard.

props.synopsis: Hackers have accessed the emails, passwords and names of past and present students from all Victorian government schools in a major data breach.

title.children: Hackers access student emails, passwords in major school data breach

image.altText: A damaged broadcast centre

props.synopsis: A fast-moving fire has silenced free-to-air TV and radio across central Victoria — and it could take months to fix the site.

title.children: Fire at Mount Alexander silences central Victoria broadcasts

image.altText: Tom Silvagni, whose name was suppressed throughout his criminal proceedings, pictured in a suit outside court.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for convicted rapist Tom Silvagni, the son of AFL great Stephen Silvagni and TV personality Jo Silvagni, have filed an application for leave to appeal.

title.children: Tom Silvagni files application to appeal rape conviction

image.altText: Kazem Hamad wearing a black T-shirt sitting next to two unidentified men with their faces blurred.

props.synopsis: Iraqi authorities have confirmed the convicted heroin trafficker and illegal tobacco boss has been arrested for alleged drug importation and smuggling.

title.children: 'Number one target' tobacco kingpin Kazem Hamad arrested in Iraq

image.altText: man with moustache and beard, sunglasses, and baseball cap wears a beige short sleeve shirt stands in front of a white truck

props.synopsis: Some Indian truck drivers have copped so much racist abuse they have stopped using their CB radios.

title.children: Indian truckies fed up with racist tirades over their CB radios

image.altText: An aerial photo showing land burnt and land not burnt

props.synopsis: Victoria's bushfires have now burnt across 404,000 hectares, or a total area more than five times the size of Singapore.

title.children: More than 220 homes now confirmed lost in Victorian bushfires

image.altText: Three politicians sit behind a desk, while a video call is shown on a screen.

props.synopsis: Representatives of the Jewish community and Australian National Imams Council front a snap parliamentary hearing called to probe Labor's legislative response to the Bondi terror attack.

title.children: 'Just get rid of it': Call to scrap religious text carve-out in hate laws

image.altText: Benches equipped with monitors and microphones sit in a courtroom, with a large screen mounted on a wall.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne courtroom descended into chaos as the 23-year-old man accused of assaulting Ismet Purdic and his wife attempted to climb out of the dock moments after being denied bail.

title.children: Chaos in court as man accused of assaulting Muslim leader is denied bail

image.altText: A helicopter flies of a forested area on fire with lots of smoke.

props.synopsis: A $15 million recovery package to help Victorians begin the massive clean-up process is the latest round of bushfire funding announced by the state government.

title.children: $15m allocated to help Victorians begin massive bushfire clean-up

image.altText: Tony Rowlinson in a baseball cap hosing a fire

props.synopsis: A town in the NSW Snowy Mountains is housing evacuees seeking refuge from the Victorian bushfires.

title.children: Tourists replaced by bushfire evacuees at border holiday town

image.altText: An old photograph of a young girl

props.synopsis: As police up the reward to $1 million for information that will lead to the remains of missing school girl Eloise Worledge, questions remain about why police disregarded a known rapist in their investigation.

title.children: The man cops overlooked in Eloise Worledge disappearance
